meanings.definition: Bangbellies (noun): plural form of bangbelly, referring to a person or animal with a large, protruding belly.
meanings.sent1: The circus elephant had bangbellies that jiggled as it walked.
meanings.sent2: The cartoon character was drawn with cute bangbellies peeking out from under its shirt.
meanings.sent3: The baby's bangbellies made everyone in the family laugh during mealtime.
meanings.sent4: The bangbellies of the sumo wrestlers seemed to have a gravitational pull of their own.
meanings.sent5: In the hot sun, the dog lay on its back, exposing its bangbellies for a cool breeze.

meanings.definition: Bangbellies (verb): third person present form of bangbelly, meaning to hit or strike someone's belly with force.
meanings.sent1: He playfully bangbellies his little brother during their roughhousing.
meanings.sent2: The boxer accidentally bangbellies his opponent during the match.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would bangbellies with anyone who challenged him to a belly dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to bangbellies with the earth, shaking everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to be careful not to bangbellies the dough too hard while kneading it.

meanings.definition: Bangbellies (adjective): describing something related to or characteristic of bangbellies.
meanings.sent1: The bangbellies costume at the party was a big hit with the kids.
meanings.sent2: The bangbellies design on the shirt made it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The bangbellies dance moves of the performer brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The bangbellies colors of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The bangbellies sound of the drums echoed through the valley, captivating all who heard it.
